com.samskivert.swing

Class RadialMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.swing.RadialMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, EventListener

    public class RadialMenu
extends Object
implements MouseMotionListener, MouseListener
    Provides a radial menu with iconic menu items that expand to include textual descriptions when moused over.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RadialMenu.Host
      The interface used to communicate back to the component that hosts this menu.
      static interface  RadialMenu.IconPredicate
      An additional interface that can be implemented by the predicate to display extra status.
      static interface  RadialMenu.Predicate
      Used to determine at the time that a menu is shown, whether its items should be included and/or enabled.

      Constructors

      RadialMenu()
      Constructs a radial menu.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RadialMenu

    • Method Detail

      • addMenuItem

        public RadialMenuItem addMenuItem(String command,
                                  String label,
                                  Image icon,
                                  RadialMenu.Predicate predicate)
        Adds a menu item to the menu. The menu should not currently be active.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to be issued when the item is selected.
        label - the textual label to be displayed with the menu item.
        icon - the icon to display next to the menu text or null if no icon is desired.
        predicate - a predicate that will be used to determine whether or not this menu item should be included in the menu and enabled when it is shown.
        Returns:
        the item that was added to the menu. It can be modified while the menu is not being displayed.

      • addMenuItem

        public void addMenuItem(RadialMenuItem item,
                        boolean makeDefault)
        Adds an already constructed menu item to the menu. The menu should not currently be active.
        Parameters:
        item - the menu item instance to be added.

      • addMenuItem

        public void addMenuItem(RadialMenuItem item)
        Adds an already constructed menu item to the menu. The menu should not currently be active.
        Parameters:
        item - the menu item instance to be added.

      • removeMenuItem

        public void removeMenuItem(RadialMenuItem item)
        Removes the specified menu item from this menu.

      • removeMenuItem

        public boolean removeMenuItem(String command)
        Removes the first menu item that matches the specified command from this menu.
        Returns:
        true if a matching menu item was removed, false if not.

      • itemUpdated

        public void itemUpdated()
        May be called by an item when it changes in a material way.

      • addActionListener

        public void addActionListener(ActionListener listener)
        Adds a listener that will be notified when a menu item is selected. When the the menu is popped down, all listeners will be cleared.

      • setCenterIcon

        public void setCenterIcon(Icon icon)
        Sets the optional centerpiece icon to be displayed in the center of the menu.

      • activate

        public void activate(RadialMenu.Host host,
                     Rectangle bounds,
                     Object argument)
        Activates the radial menu, rendering a menu around the prescribed bounds. It is expected that the host component will subsequently call render(java.awt.Graphics2D) if the menu invalidates the region of the component occupied by the menu and requests it to repaint.
        Parameters:
        host - the host component within which the radial menu is displayed.
        bounds - the bounds of the object that was clicked to activate the menu.
        argument - a reference to an object that will be provided along with the command that is issued if the user selects a menu item (unless that item has an overriding argument, in which case the overriding argument will be used).

      • activate

        public void activate(RadialMenu.Host host,
                     Rectangle bounds)
        Activates the radial menu, rendering a menu around the prescribed bounds. It is expected that the host component will subsequently call render(java.awt.Graphics2D) if the menu invalidates the region of the component occupied by the menu and requests it to repaint.
        Parameters:
        host - the host component within which the radial menu is displayed.
        bounds - the bounds of the object that was clicked to activate the menu.

      • setActivationArgument

        public void setActivationArgument(Object arg)
        Sets the argument that will be defaultly posted along with commands.

      • getActivationArgument

        public Object getActivationArgument()
        Returns the argument provided to this menu when activate(com.samskivert.swing.RadialMenu.Host, java.awt.Rectangle, java.lang.Object) was called. This will only be non-null while the menu is active and only then if an argument was provided in the call to activate(com.samskivert.swing.RadialMenu.Host, java.awt.Rectangle, java.lang.Object).

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates the menu.

      • render

        public void render(Graphics2D gfx)
        Renders the current configuration of this menu.
